Sets the position indicator of the input and/or output sequence relative to some other position.

@1@ Calls {{c|seekoff(off, dir, which)}} of the most derived class.

@2@ The base class version of this function has no effect. The derived classes may override this function to allow relative positioning of the position indicator.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|off|relative position to set the position indicator to.}}
{{par|dir|defines base position to apply the relative offset to. It can be one of the following constants:
{{cpp/io/ios_base/seekdir consts}} }}
{{par|which|defines which of the input and/or output sequences to affect. It can be one or a combination of the following constants:
{{cpp/io/ios_base/openmode streambuf consts}}}}
{{par end}}

===Note===
Not all combinations of parameters may be valid, see the derived versions of {{tt|seekoff}} for details.

===Return value===
@1@ The return value of {{c|seekoff(off, dir, which)}}

@2@ The resulting absolute position as defined by the position indicator. The base class version returns {{c|pos_type(off_type(-1))}}.
